Materials¶

class material.Material(name, x, u, m=None, V=None, rho=None)[source]¶

Representation of an abstract material with initial conditions given by the parameters length \(n_p\) ndarray vectors m, x and u.

Parameters:
  • x (ndarray) – particle position vector \(\mathbf{x}_p\)
  • u (ndarray) – particle velocity vector \(\mathbf{u}_p\)
  • m (ndarray) – particle mass vector \(\mathbf{m}_p\)
  • V (ndarray) – particle volume vector \(\mathbf{V}_p\)
  • rho (float) – particle density \(\rho\)

In creation of this class, a number of particle state paramters are initialized. These are:

  • self.n – number of particles \(n_p\)
  • self.d – topological dimension \(d\)
  • self.m – \(n_p \times 1\) mass vector \(\mathbf{m}_p\)
  • self.x – \(n_p \times d\) position vector \(\mathbf{x}_p\)
  • self.u – \(n_p \times d\) velocity vector \(\mathbf{u}_p\)
  • self.a – \(n_p \times d\) acceleration vector \(\mathbf{a}_p\)
  • self.grad_u – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) velocity gradient tensors \(\nabla \mathbf{u}_p\)
  • self.vrt – \(n_p \times n_n\) grid nodal indicies for points \(i\)
  • self.phi – \(n_p \times n_n\) grid basis values at points \(\phi(\mathbf{x}_p)\)
  • self.grad_phi – \(n_p \times (n_n \times d)\) grid basis gradient tensors at points \(\nabla \phi_i(\mathbf{x}_p)\)
  • self.rho0 – \(n_p \times 1\) initial density vector \(\rho_p^0\)
  • self.rho – \(n_p \times 1\) density vector \(\rho_p^t\)
  • self.V0 – \(n_p \times 1\) initial volume vector \(V_p^0\)
  • self.V – \(n_p \times 1\) volume vector \(V_p\)
  • self.F – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) deformation gradient tensors \(F_p\)
  • self.sigma – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) stress tensors \(\sigma_p\)
  • self.epsilon – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) strain tensors \(\epsilon_p\)
  • self.depsilon – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) strain-rate tensors \(\dot{\epsilon}_p\)
  • self.I – \(n_p \times (d \times d)\) identity tensors \(I\)
  • self.vrt – \(n_p \times n_v\) nodal vertex indices for each particle
calculate_strain_rate()[source]¶

Calculate the particle strain-rate tensor

\[\dot{\epsilon}_p = \frac{1}{2} \left( \nabla \mathbf{u}_p + \left( \nabla \mathbf{u}_p \right)^{\intercal} \right)\]

from particle velocity \(\mathbf{u}_p\).

calculate_stress()[source]¶

This method must be implemented by child classes.

color()[source]¶

The color used for printing messages to the screen.

Return type:string
cpp_module()[source]¶

return the appropriate cpp module to instantiate this material.

This method must be implemented by child classes.

get_cpp_material(element)[source]¶

instantiate and return the cpp module for this material with element type element.

plot()[source]¶

Plot the positions of each particle with coordinates self.X to the screen.

retrieve_cpp_F()[source]¶

Get the particle deformation gradient from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_V()[source]¶

Get the current particle volume vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_V0()[source]¶

Get the initial particle volume vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_a()[source]¶

Get the particle acceleration vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_depsilon()[source]¶

Get the particle strain-rate tensor from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_epsilon()[source]¶

Get the particle strain tensor from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_grad_phi()[source]¶

Get the particle basis function gradient values from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_grad_u()[source]¶

Get the particle velocity gradient from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_phi()[source]¶

Get the grid basis function values evaluated at each particle’s current position from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_rho()[source]¶

Get the current particle density vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_rho0()[source]¶

Get the initial particle density vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_sigma()[source]¶

Get the particle stress tensor from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_u()[source]¶

Get the particle velocity vector from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_vrt()[source]¶

Get the nodal indices at each particle’s position from the C++ model.

retrieve_cpp_x()[source]¶

Get the particle position vector from the C++ model.

set_cpp_material(cpp_mat)[source]¶

Instantiante the C++ code object self.cpp_mat for this material to cpp_mat.

Parameters:element (FiniteElement) – The FEniCS element used.
class material.ElasticMaterial(name, x, u, E, nu, m=None, V=None, rho=None)[source]¶

Representation of an elastic material with initial conditions given by the parameters m, x, u, E, and nu.

Parameters:
  • m (ndarray) – particle mass vector \(\mathbf{m}_p\)
  • x (ndarray) – particle position vector \(\mathbf{x}_p\)
  • u (ndarray) – particle velocity vector \(\mathbf{u}_p\)
  • E (float) – Young’s modulus \(E\)
  • nu (float) – Poisson’s ratio \(\nu\)
calculate_stress()[source]¶

Calculate elastic particle-Cauchy-stress tensor

\[\sigma_p = 2 \mu \epsilon_p + \lambda \mathrm{tr} \left( \epsilon_p \right) I\]

with Lamé parameters \(\mu\) and \(\lambda\).

color()[source]¶

The color used for printing messages to the screen.

Return type:string
cpp_module()[source]¶

return the appropriate cpp module to instantiate this material.

This method must be implemented by child classes.
